concept.title: Working with maps
concept.shortdesc: A ditamap is how you organize your content.

conbody.p: There are two major types of ditamaps.

dd.p: A map style ditamap is just a table of contents. You can add a title, but not much else. You can create a hierarchy of topics.
Used with non-PDF content, such as HTML output, or to reuse.

Intended for use with books. Bookmaps contain a lot of metadata to create all the front and back matter of a book, such as titles, sub-titles, publisher information, copyright information. You can also add specific references for chapters, appendicies, table of contents, index, and so on.

conbody.p: There are other styles of maps, but 95% of the time you only work with bookmaps and maps.
